poem:
Title: Of Hostage Hearts and Distant Talks

A waltz of words dance in the morning's light,
Across the chessboard of diplomacy.
"A lot of work" echoes in the night,
Under the weight of a ceasefire's urgency.
Blinken, the bard, in a weary debate,
Against the ceaseless tide of human fate.
His tale and task, spinning ceaselessly,
For peace, a fate we long to see.

Reports in Egyptian media on Wednesday said negotiations were ongoing in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
